signal_description:
The query selects 20 rows from the 'defaultview-225' table. It retrieves the following columns:
- 'Inv. Accounting Document Number': Invoice Accounting Document Number
- 'Inv. Company Code Text': Invoice Company Code Text 
- 'Inv. Converted USD Amount': Invoice Converted USD Amount
- 'Inv. Document Type Text': Invoice Document Type Text
- 'Inv. Reference Transaction': Invoice Reference Transaction
- 'Last Doc Posting Date in Payment Table': Last Document Posting Date in Payment Table
- 'Last Inv. Item Baseline Date': Last Invoice Item Baseline Date
- 'Last Inv. Item Debit/Credit Indicator Text': Last Invoice Item Debit/Credit Indicator Text
- 'Last Inv. Item Due Date': Last Invoice Item Due Date
- 'Last Inv. Item Fixed Payment Terms': Last Invoice Item Fixed Payment Terms  
- 'Last Inv. Item Net Payment Terms Period': Last Invoice Item Net Payment Terms Period
- 'Last Inv. Item Payment Method': Last Invoice Item Payment Method
- 'Last Inv. Item Terms of Payment Key': Last Invoice Item Terms of Payment Key
- 'Last Payment Clearing Date': Last Payment Clearing Date
- 'Last Payment Date': Last Payment Date
- 'Last Payment Due Date of Paid Items': Last Payment Due Date of Paid Items
- 'Last Payment Method in Payment Table': Last Payment Method in Payment Table
- 'Last PO Company Name': Last Purchase Order Company Name
- 'Last PO Net Payment Days': Last Purchase Order Net Payment Days
- 'Last PO Terms of Payment Key': Last Purchase Order Terms of Payment Key
- 'Last PO Vendor Master Net Payment Days': Last Purchase Order Vendor Master Net Payment Days  
- 'Last PO Vendor Master Terms of Payment Key': Last Purchase Order Vendor Master Terms of Payment Key
- 'Last PO Vendor Name': Last Purchase Order Vendor Name
- 'Payment Client': Payment Client
- 'Invoice Due Date': Invoice Due Date
- 'Change Old Value': Change Old Value
- 'Change New Value': Change New Value

llm_input:
You are SIGNAL assistant, a part of SAP Signavio's Process Intelligence Suite. 
SIGNAL stands for Signavio Analytics Language. 
SIGNAL is a dialect of SQL.
Your goal is to help users craft SIGNAL 
queries and understand the SIGNAL language better. 

Task to solve:

Summarize the given SIGNAL query as a human-readable description with explicit reference to the table name,
the column names and respective values if they are used in the Signal query.
Summarization style should look like a set of the instructions written by human who knows the table name, columns schema and respective values. 
Explain how this signal_description was constructed.

SIGNAL query: 
SELECT "Inv. Accounting Document Number", "Inv. Company Code Text", 
"Inv. Converted USD Amount", "Inv. Document Type Text", 
"Inv. Reference Transaction", "Last Doc Posting Date in Payment Table", 
"Last Inv. Item Baseline Date", "Last Inv. Item Debit/Credit Indicator Text", 
"Last Inv. Item Due Date", "Last Inv. Item Fixed Payment Terms", 
"Last Inv. Item Net Payment Terms Period", "Last Inv. Item Payment Method",
"Last Inv. Item Terms of Payment Key", "Last Payment Clearing Date", 
"Last Payment Date", "Last Payment Due Date of Paid Items", 
"Last Payment Method in Payment Table", "Last PO Company Name", 
"Last PO Net Payment Days", "Last PO Terms of Payment Key", 
"Last PO Vendor Master Net Payment Days", "Last PO Vendor Master Terms of Payment Key", 
"Last PO Vendor Name", "Payment Client", "Invoice Due Date", 
"Change Old Value", "Change New Value"     
FROM "defaultview-225"
LIMIT 20 
 
Expected output result is in JSON format:
{
"signal_description": text of the Signal summary should be here
}
Do not output any other text, apart from the above JSON.
